div1.p: The authors urge that the American Line from Santiago transport soldiers to the North. Attached to the telegram is a note dated August 4, 1898. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Telegram from Charles Lockhart, A. S. Allen, Henry L. Davis, W. L. King, and F. S. Landsteet to William McKinley, August 5, [1898]
div1.p: Essex And Sussex Springs Lake NJ Aug 5

We would respectfully urge that the soldiers at Santiago have the speed and
comfort afforded by the vessels of the American Line for transportation
north. We cannot think of any way in which these vessels can be of such service to
the country as in bringing north our brave men.

Chas Lockhart; A.S. Allen; Henry L. Davis; W.L. King; F.S. Landstreet and
many others

OFFICE OF ADJUTANT GENERAL
JUN 3
241037
D.
1899
WAR DEPARTMENT

Letter signed by General
officers was given out before
it reached him. - Knows
nothing of Roosevelts letter.
